Variables

static int s_tag_assigner = 0

Detailed Description

Definitions for SPU-initiated DMA transfer helpers.

Note:
the CTK's DMA transfer routines accept unaligned addr and sizes, but you should specify aligned ones to get reasonal perfornace.

Define Documentation

 
#define ctk_dma_new_tag (  )     (s_tag_assigner = (s_tag_assigner & 0xf), s_tag_assigner++)

ctk_dma_new_tag: get a new DMA tag

Returns:
a new tag group ID

Function Documentation

static void ctk_dma_get ( void *  ls_addr,
ea_addr_t  ea_addr,
dma_size_t  size,
int  tag 
) [inline, static]

DMA get operation (from EA to LS)

Parameters:
[in] ls_addr - destination LS addr (must be 16-byte aligned)
[in] ea_addr - source EA addr (must be 16-byte aligned)
[in] size - transfer size (must be 16-byte aligned)
[in] tag - DMA tag to be associated to the initiating transfer
Returns:
void

) [inline, static]

blocking DMA get operation (from EA to LS)

Parameters:

[in] size - transfer size (must be 16-byte aligned)
Returns:

static void ctk_dma_get_small ( void *  ls_addr,
ea_addr_t  ea_addr,
dma_size_t  size,
int  tag 
) [inline, static]

DMA get operation (from EA to LS) only for small size transfer (< DMA_TRANSFER_SIZE). The transfer size should be less than the DMA maximum transfer size (per one command). For smaller transfers this should be faster than the generic get routine ctk_dma_get.

Parameters:
[in] ls_addr - destination LS addr
[in] ea_addr - source EA addr
[in] size - transfer size (must be < DMA_TRANSFER_SIZE)
[in] tag - DMA tag to be associated to the initiating transfer
Returns:
void

static void ctk_dma_get_small_block ( void *  ls_addr,
ea_addr_t  ea_addr,
dma_size_t  size 
) [inline, static]

blocking DMA get operation (from LS to EA) only for small size transfer (< DMA_TRANSFER_SIZE). This routine won't return until the DMA transfer finishes. The transfer size should be less than the DMA maximum transfer size (per one command).

Parameters:
[in] ls_addr - source LS addr
[in] ea_addr - destination EA addr
[in] size - transfer size (must be < DMA_TRANSFER_SIZE)
Returns:
void

ea_addr_t  ea_addr,
dma_size_t  size,
int  tag 
) [inline, static]

DMA put operation (from LS to EA) only for small size transfer (< DMA_TRANSFER_SIZE). The transfer size should be less than the DMA maximum transfer size (per one command). For smaller transfers this should be faster than the generic put routine ctk_dma_put.

Parameters:
[in] ls_addr - source LS addr
[in] ea_addr - destination EA addr
[in] size - transfer size (must be < DMA_TRANSFER_SIZE)
[in] tag - DMA tag to be associated to the initiating transfer
Returns:
void

static int ctk_dma_read_tag_status ( int  tag_mask  )  [inline, static]

ctk_dma_read_tag_status: Checks the status of DMA transfers specified by the given tag_mask.

See also:
ctk_dma_wait_all, ctk_dma_wait_any
Parameters:
[in] tag_mask - DMA tag(s) mask to be checked.
Returns:
non-zero (>0) if ANY of requested DMA transfers specified by tag_mask completes, 0 otherwise.

static void ctk_dma_transfer ( void *  ls_addr,
ea_addr_t  ea_addr,
dma_size_t  size,
int  tag,
int  cmd 
) [inline, static]

DMA transfer (generic routine).

Parameters:
[in] ls_addr - LS addr (must be 16-byte aligned)
[in] ea_addr - EA addr (must be 16-byte aligned)
[in] size - transfer size
[in] tag - DMA tag to be associated to the initiating transfer
[in] cmd - DMA command to issue
Returns:
void

dma_size_t  size,
int  tag,

static void ctk_dma_wait ( int  tag  )  [inline, static]

ctk_dma_wait: DMA sync operation

Parameters:
[in] tag - DMA tag to be waited
Returns:
void

static void ctk_dma_wait_all ( int  tag_mask  )  [inline, static]

ctk_dma_wait_all: blocks until ALL of the DMA transfers specified by the given tag_mask have done. Tag masks can be constructed by calling macros CTK_DMA_TAG_SET and CTK_DMA_TAG_CLR.

Parameters:
[in] tag_mask - DMA tag mask to be waited
Returns:
void

static void ctk_dma_wait_any ( int  tag_mask  )  [inline, static]

ctk_dma_wait_any: blocks until ANY of the DMA transfers specified by the given tag_mask have done. Tag masks can be constructed by calling macros CTK_DMA_TAG_SET and CTK_DMA_TAG_CLR.

Parameters:
[in] tag_mask - DMA tag mask to be waited
Returns:
void
